message.content:
{"id": "2694", 
 "title": "Bug 2694: Editor Selection Dialog: UI suggestions (1GI6RPE)",
 "description": "Bug 2694: Editor Selection Dialog: UI suggestions (1GI6RPE)

Press 'Add' for the associated editors.

a. Enable multiple selection.

c. Mark the default entry in the associated editors list as '(default)' (similar to perspectives).

NOTES:
KLM (10/10/2001 1:54:57 PM)
Also:

f. The dialog needs a width hint.

 g. The File Editors Preferences page grows in height when selected, but no other pages do the same.

I currently have fixes for a, c, f. Need to release.

KLM (10/10/2001 5:58:58 PM)
Released fixes for a, c, f, g.
",
 "OB": "a. The 'Add' button should not add a hidden entry.


f. The dialog should have a width hint for better display.

g. The File Editors Preferences page should not grow in height when selected, like other pages.

",
 "EB": "'Add' should not add a hidden entry.


f. The dialog should have a width hint.

g. The File Editors Preferences page should not grow in height when selected, unlike other pages.
",
 "SR": "MA (09.08.2001 12:04:06)
1. Go to the Workbench File Editors preference page.
2. Without selecting anything from the 'Internal Editors' section, switch to the 'External Editors' section and select an entry.
3. Switch back to Internal Editors and press 'OK'. This should not add the selected external editor.
"}

Multiple selection could be enabledc. The default entry in the associated editors list could be marked (default) (see perspectives)NOTES:KLM (10/10/2001 1:54:57 PM)Also:f. Need a width hint for the dialogg. Why does the File editors Pref page grow in height when it is selected, but no other pagesdo the same?I currently have fixes for a, c, fNeed to releaseKLM (10/10/2001 5:58:58 PM)released fixes for a, c, f, g ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "'Add' should not add a hidden entry.d. Entries already existing in the associated editors should not be available for selectione. ", 'SR': "MA (09.08.2001 12:04:06)1. in the preference page go to WorkbenchFile Editors2. Without selecting something from the 'Internal Editors' go to 'External Editors' and select an entry.Switch back to Internal: (Still no selection), press OK This adds you the selected external editor. "}
